abstract: Amherst College trustees announce they will not longer use Lord Jeffery Amherst as school's unofficial mascot, and will not refer to him in official communications or logos; group of mostly alumni and students will consider whether to adopt new and official mascot to replace colonial-era military commander, now seen as symbol of oppression against Native Americans.

headline.print_headline: Amherst College Drops Mascot Seen as a Symbol of Oppression
headline.main: Amherst College Drops ‘Lord Jeff’ as Mascot

snippet: The move follows student protests over the use of Lord Jeffery Amherst, a colonial military commander who suggested killing Native Americans with smallpox-infected blankets.
lead_paragraph: The move follows student protests over the use of Lord Jeffery Amherst, a colonial military commander who suggested killing Native Americans with smallpox-infected blankets.
